attributes.action: Take over a council tenancy when parents pass away.
attributes.additional_details: I want this done because  My Mother and father had a joint tenancy agreement from the local council. They moved in in 1977 and raised 7 children in this family home. My Mother has since passed away in 2014 and shortly after my father was ill so I moved in with him in 2018 become his main carer. Now sadly my father has passed away, but my name is down as a family member living  at the property as this is my main home the council now intend to end my dad's tenancy and apply to take the house back
attributes.background: I would like the govenment to make it more possible and easier for a family member living with a parent or parents in a council property to take over the tenancy when the parent or both parents pass away.

rejection.details:
You may wish to sign this petition calling for the same action: 

Allow bereaved children to succeed tenancy of council-owned properties
https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/587208
